    • Method Detail

      • authorize

        protected User authorize(java.lang.String path,
                         org.json.JSONObject content,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers)
                  throws AuthorizationException
        The user identified in the AuthenticatedUser headers must be authorized to perform this action. For HTTP, MDW removes this header (if it exists) from every request and then populates based on session authentication or HTTP Basic.
        Parameters:
        content -
        Returns:
        authorized user if successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationException

      • getRoles

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRoles(java.lang.String path,
                                                    java.lang.String method)
        Default impl pays no attention to method (for compatibility). GET access if restricted if the "Runtime View" role exists.

      • getRoles

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRoles(java.lang.String path)
        A user who belongs to any role in the returned list is allowed to perform this action/method. Override to open access beyond Site Admin.
        Parameters:
        path -
        Returns:
        list of role names or null if authorization not required

      • getRequiredProperty

        protected java.lang.String getRequiredProperty(java.lang.String propName)
                                        throws ServiceException
        Throws:

        ServiceException

      • generateRequestId

        protected java.lang.String generateRequestId()
        If you have a unique id that's meaningful (e.g.: order number), it's recommended that you use that for requestId. However we can generate one if you'd like.
